Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the application, including scalability, reliability, and performance needs. Identify the services and workloads that will run on Azure Service Fabric.
Design the cluster architecture, including the number of nodes, node types, and placement constraints. Plan for high availability and fault tolerance.
Create and configure the Service Fabric cluster in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure the cluster is provisioned with the required node types and capacity.
Set up security for the cluster, including certificate-based authentication, role-based access control (RBAC), and encryption for data in transit and at rest.
Package and deploy applications to the Service Fabric cluster using Visual Studio, Azure DevOps, or other CI/CD tools. Ensure proper versioning and rollback mechanisms are in place.
Set up monitoring and diagnostics for the cluster using Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and Service Fabric Explorer. Configure alerts for cluster health and application performance.
Perform thorough testing of the cluster and applications, including failover scenarios, load testing, and performance benchmarking.
Set up backup and disaster recovery mechanisms for the cluster and applications. Ensure data replication and recovery processes are tested and documented.
Review and optimize cluster configurations for cost efficiency and performance. Adjust node types, scaling policies, and resource allocations as needed.
Create detailed documentation for the cluster setup, application deployment processes, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Service Fabric cluster and applications.
Ensure the cluster and applications meet regulatory compliance requirements. Conduct regular audits to verify security and operational standards.
